result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold Ray Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Harold Ray Schmidt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Harold Ray Schmidt was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to 15CF4254 any other sentence, with credit for 114 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge. Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by applying bail on deposit on this case.  Remaining balance to be transferred to case 15CF4254.   If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
Defendant to stay away from taverns.

Cooperate with agent.
Follow all rules of probation.
Cooperate with any treatment programs recommended by agency.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment, including inpatient treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $3,995.94 entered as ordered by the court on 02/22/16 to pay $100.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 09/03/19. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment. (Atty. payment plan is for both cases 15CF02269 & 15CF04254).

Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNT 1 and COUNT 3 DISMISSED.    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.   

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to 15CF4254 any other sentence, with credit for 114 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 5 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by applying bail on deposit on this case.  Remaining balance to be transferred to case 15CF4254.   If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by applying bail on deposit on this case and any bail left on case 15CF4254; remaining balance, if any, to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment  
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment, including inpatient treatment
-Follow all rules of probation
-Cooperate with any treatment programs recommended by agency 
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to stay away from taverns 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant informs the court that he understand his jury trial date is set outside the speedy trial limit. Defendant waives his speedy trial demand to 10.12.15.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Harold Ray Schmidt not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court grants approves additional funds to be paid to defense counsel for legal fees. Defense counsel enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of the defendant.    Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9.14.15 and for jury trial on  10.12.15.  Counsel is aware that speedy expires on 10.7.15. All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for 07-09-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed.

Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in custody.  Joanne Hardtke for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court appoints Attorney Thomas Harris.  Defendant to reimburse the County at the rate of $100 per month commencing 8.9.15.  Case adjourned for a preliminary hearing on 6.16.15 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt not in court, defendant in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for an indigency hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt not in court, defendant in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not retained counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07.  Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing on June 8, 2015 in Branch 07.  Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Harold Ray Schmidt in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
